column4: saik0; did you pass -v so you get the list? if so, xargs rm and paste it.. if not you'll have to unpack it somewhere else and use find to go through the list and remove the erroneous files
saik0; you'll get breakage if it overwrote anything though
just do tar -tf to get the list again - tar -tf x.tar | xargs rm should do it
yeah that'll work.. i don't mess with tar enough to remember all of its capabilities off the top of my head ;)
